meanings.definition: Increasing or growing by accumulation or successive additions.
meanings.sent1: The cumulative effect of studying a little bit every day is impressive.
meanings.sent2: The teacher calculated the cumulative score of all the quizzes to determine the final grade.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the cumulative amount of snow on the car increasing throughout the day.
meanings.sent4: The cumulative weight of all the books on the shelf made it bend under the pressure.
meanings.sent5: The cumulative impact of his actions over time was undeniable.

meanings.definition: Forming a total sum by adding together successive amounts.
meanings.sent1: The cumulative cost of buying a coffee every morning adds up quickly.
meanings.sent2: The company's cumulative revenue for the year exceeded expectations.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to watch the cumulative number of balloons filling up the room.
meanings.sent4: The cumulative effect of her kindness created a warm atmosphere in the office.
meanings.sent5: The cumulative distance he ran each day eventually led to completing a marathon.
